KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.synopsis: Umi, Mattis and Ide are discussing a plan to rescue their friend Mol from Moonrise.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD.how_to_trigger: This AD will occur after Mol is taken to Moonrise.

AD_Mattis.synopsis: AD for Mattis, a cheeky Dodger type character selling trinkets in the Last Light Inn. Mattis is shouting out, trying to draw customers in.

AD_PlayerFoundTreasure_UmisComment.synopsis: AD in which Umi sees the player finding a treasure. Disappointed because he'd been looking for a cool treasure and had found nothing.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack.synopsis: Group dialogs for Tiefling kids when Mol is kidnapped. Ide, Mattis, Umi (and Mirkon, if he survived the harpy attack in the grove) are planning on sneaking out and heading to Moonrise to rescue their 'boss', Mol. The player can offer to go in their place, or encourage them to go (if they go, they die).

Weaponsmith.synopsis: This is the Haven state and dialogue for Dammon if he is rescued and brought back to the inn. He can be traded with in certain states and can forge a weapon of hellish power if the player brings him the right material.
Weaponsmith.how_to_trigger: Speak to Dammon after saving the groveOR (Debug Path)1. Select Act 2 set up in debug book2. Dammon spawns near the stables and is available for talk.

Mirkon.synopsis: Mirkon is the boy who survived the Harpies trying to lull him into the water in the grove. He is a timid boy who does his best to be brave, and dreams of being an adventurer one day. This is his dialogue in Haven, which covers the main states of the kidnapping, losing Isobel, reporting that his fellow tieflings died, when the player returns them and so on.

Mattis.synopsis: Dialog with Mattis in Haven. He's a young tiefling boy who dreams of opening up his own shop in baldur's gate. He's delighted to be given the responsibility of the 'shop' in the Last Light Inn and does his best to sound more 'grown-up' and 'formal'. But he fumbles it a bit.This is his main dialogue in Haven and covers all major states, Isobel and Mol kidnapped, the Inn attacked, tieflings dead, etc.

AD_PlayerFoundTreasure_MirkonsComment.synopsis: AD which Mirkon says if he sees the player finding a treasure which is hidden behind a wall. Excited and child-like.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_8.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_8.text: Yeah, 'cause she did a great job protecting Mol.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_10.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_10.text: Maybe we should ask someone else?
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_10.context: NodeContext: kind of coming around to umi's thinking

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_7.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_7.text: Who? No one cares - no one but us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_7.context: NodeContext: determined - feeling like she's on her own

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_4.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_4.context: NodeContext: Unsure. You want to save your friend but you also want to be cautious

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_3.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_3.text: It's fine! Jaheira won't even notice we're gone.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_0.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_0.text: Even if she did, it doesn't matter. Mol needs us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_0.context: NodeContext: Determined, you're gonna save mol no matter what

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_6.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_6.text: I know, I know. But we need a plan.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_5.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_5.context: NodeContext: impatient, you want to save mol right now

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_2.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_2.text: But we don't even know the way to Moonrise.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_9.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_9.text: That's why we should leave now!
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_AD_9.context: NodeContext: impatient, you want to save mol right now

AD_Mattis_1.speaker: Mattis
AD_Mattis_1.text: Last Light's best bargains, right here.

AD_Mattis_2.speaker: Mattis
AD_Mattis_2.text: Don't be shy, have a gander at the finest stock!

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_16.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_16.text: Mol would do the same for any of us. You know it.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Determined. Ide would die for Mol. Arguing everyone should leave and save her.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_17.speaker: Umi
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_17.text: But how do we get into Moonrise? We can't fight those shadow things.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Afraid. Trying to be the voice of reason.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_1.speaker: Mirkon
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_1.text: We could! I beat up those harpies and they're way scarier than shadows.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Surprisingly confident. This is Mirkon's moment to be an adventurer he'd always dreamed. (he didn't actually beat up the harpies)

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_10.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_10.text: You know what Mol would hate more than anything? Bad things happening to us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kids are talking amongst themselves. NodeContext: Trying to be smart and calculated.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_4.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_4.text: You've seen what's out there. We wouldn't stand a chance.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_7.speaker: Player
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_7.text: You stay put - I'll bring Mol home.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_8.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_8.text: But it's our job to bring Mol back.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at playerNodeContext: Hesitant and suspicious, looking the player over. Saying 'Mol' like you'd say 'the President'

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_0.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_0.text: Look at them - they're a proper adventurer. And if we got hurt Mol would be really mad at us.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the player. NodeContext: Trying to convince Ide. Also a little scared of Mol's reaction.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_15.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_15.text: Fine. But you gotta understand, Mol is family. Bring her back - please.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_2.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_2.text: You don't know what you're talking about - Mol's a survivor.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_9.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_9.text: We'll see her again. She's twice the hero you'll ever be.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_13.speaker: Player
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_13.text: Mol's resourceful - she'll find her way back.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_14.speaker: Mattis
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_14.text: I know she will. But look out for her, would you? Just in case she needs help.

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_12.speaker: Player
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_12.text: You seem very close to this Mol. What is the nature of your bond?

KidsAfterGhoulAttack_6.speaker: Ide
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_6.text: She's the best kind of family - one we got to pick ourselves.
KidsAfterGhoulAttack_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at playerNodeContext: Confident and proud

Weaponsmith_14.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_14.text: There you are! I'd hoped you'd made it through, but when we didn't hear from you... well. I'm glad you're here now.

Weaponsmith_18.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_18.text: I thought it was you - saving my skin again, I see. Never seen a shapeshifted ox before, but I'm glad you dealt with it before it dealt with us.

Weaponsmith_40.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_40.text: I'm glad to see you're all right. The way here was anything but easy, eh?

Weaponsmith_32.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_32.text: Gods above and devils below! That ox was a bloody shapeshifter! Thanks for handling it.
Weaponsmith_32.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

Weaponsmith_81.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_81.text: Earlier, you mentioned you could work 'interesting' materials. What did you mean?

Weaponsmith_33.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_33.text: Glad you and Karlach are all right. Well - as all right as any of us.

Weaponsmith_59.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_59.text: A makeshift Harper's fire might not be where I hoped to set up shop, but maybe I've got something you can use anyway.

Weaponsmith_74.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_74.text: And if you find any interesting materials in need of working, I'm happy to help.
Weaponsmith_74.context: NodeContext: Said with a slightly knowing tone

Weaponsmith_49.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_49.text: I'll be here if you need anything else.

Weaponsmith_12.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_12.text: I... hesitated to mention this back in the druids' grove - for obvious reasons - but no one has earned my trust if not you.

Weaponsmith_34.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_34.text: When Elturel was dragged into Avernus, I was drafted into a devil's smithy. It should have been awful, but infernal metal is like a wild horse. Powerful, exuberant - it'll kill you if you lack technique.

Weaponsmith_28.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_28.text: I can sense some, smell it almost, somewhere in the area. Underground, maybe - out there, in the shadows.

Weaponsmith_45.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_45.text: If you find it, bring it to me. I'll make something incredible.

Weaponsmith_13.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_13.text: Sounds like you had an interesting time in the Hells.

Weaponsmith_67.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_67.text: Some of us had it easier than others. The baker, the schoolmaster - when Elturel was swallowed up, they could do little but survive.

Weaponsmith_43.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_43.text: As for me, I won't say I enjoyed my time there, but it was certainly... instructional.
Weaponsmith_43.context: NodeContext: He secretly did enjoy it but it would be very gauche to say so

Weaponsmith_51.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_51.text: I've got this metal I found in Avernus itself - will that do?

Weaponsmith_23.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_23.text: I found this metal in a place called Grymforge - what do you make of it?

Weaponsmith_16.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_16.text: I think I found a material you could work with. What can you make of it?
Weaponsmith_16.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has special hellish metal in inventory

Weaponsmith_44.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_44.text: Absolutely. Rare to get your hands on this stuff - well done keeping it to hand.
Weaponsmith_44.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N86)

Weaponsmith_5.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_5.text: It's perfect, really. Just a moment - I'll be able to work this one quickly.
Weaponsmith_5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N86)

Weaponsmith_10.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_10.text: There you are. And be careful who you show that to. It might draw the wrong kind of attention.

Weaponsmith_79.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_79.text: Well, well, well... I knew I smelled something. And I know just what to do with it. One moment.
Weaponsmith_79.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N115)

Weaponsmith_62.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_62.text: Perhaps you've misplaced it? I'll be here should you find it again.

Weaponsmith_6.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_6.text: I found some hellish masks, can you make anything of these?

Weaponsmith_52.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_52.text: Using something that's already fabricated is tough, but I can try. How many do you have?

Weaponsmith_3.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_3.text: Hm. I thought I sniffed a Merregon's scent somewhere. These must've been a pain to get a hold of.

Weaponsmith_47.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_47.text: Merregon masks are brittle, so what I make won't last as long as my usual pieces.

Weaponsmith_39.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_39.text: There. Be careful who sees you using that, might draw the wrong sort of eyes.

Weaponsmith_19.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_19.text: That's not as many as you said you had.

Weaponsmith_8.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_8.text: Actually, I'll hang on to them.

Weaponsmith_53.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_53.text: Fair enough, they might have use as they are.

Weaponsmith_76.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_76.text: If you want me to have another look, you know where to find me.

Weaponsmith_50.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_50.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

Weaponsmith_55.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_55.text: Nowhere's safe from this damned Absolute.
Weaponsmith_55.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Weaponsmith_31.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_31.text: Nor from shapeshifting cow-blob-things, though you made short enough work of that one. Glad you handled it before it handled me.

Weaponsmith_9.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_9.text: If you need something sharp, I have a few things left.

Weaponsmith_63.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_63.text: Isobel said we ought to sit tight for the time being - wait until we hear back from Jaheira. I know she's right, but I can't wait to get moving.

Weaponsmith_65.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_65.text: It's - you! What are the odds? So glad you're all right. Well - as all right as any of us.
Weaponsmith_65.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.

Weaponsmith_70.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_70.text: Can't sleep, so I might as well hammer. Need anything?
Weaponsmith_70.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Weaponsmith_27.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_27.text: I hope that fight with that hideous shapeshifted creature didn't sully your weapon too badly. You'll be needing it.

Weaponsmith_78.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_78.text: Did you see it? The path of light? That's good, right? Means we might make it out of here alive.

Mirkon_0.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_0.text: Once Ketheric is gone, we can get out of here. I can't wait.
Mirkon_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: This is the first bit of hope you've felt in a while. Thinking of the outside and travelling without fear

Mirkon_1.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_1.text: I'm so glad Mol is back. She's the best.

Mirkon_2.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_2.text: Ide keeps asking Mol if she's all right. Heh. She acts tough, but she was super worried about Mol.

Mirkon_3.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_3.text: I miss them. I miss the others.

Mirkon_4.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_4.text: The light means that Ketheric will be gone soon, right? It is! I can tell by your face!
Mirkon_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: hopeful and joyous

Mirkon_5.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_5.text: I just want to go home.
Mirkon_5.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.NodeContext: Depressed. Down. Worried.

Mirkon_6.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_6.text: This place is awesome. There's so much stuff!
Mirkon_6.context: NodeContext: excited. searching the room for 'cool stuff'

Mirkon_7.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_7.text: Mol is super tough. If anyone can handle Moonrise, she can... I think.
Mirkon_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Adults back but not the kidsNodeContext: Mostly trying to convince yourself

Mirkon_10.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_10.text: Maybe I'll find a sword. Or an axe!

Mirkon_11.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_11.text: I keep asking Jaheira about my friends, but she says she doesn't know where they are.
Mirkon_11.context: InternalNodeContext: Adults back but not the kidsNodeContext: Worried and concerned. The grown ups who are supposed to help aren't

Mirkon_12.speaker: Mirkon
Mirkon_12.text: Ide keeps asking to go treasure hunting, but I don't want to. Not anymore.

Mattis_0.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_0.text: I can't wait to get outta this dump and never come back. Grab what you can before we scarper, yeah?
Mattis_0.context: NodeContext: Sigh at the beginning fo the sentence. Excited ot get out. Sick of the place.

Mattis_21.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_21.text: My stores are always open to you - just make sure you give Ketheric a few knocks from me, yeah?
Mattis_21.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: Gleeful in the thought of beating up the 'bad guy'

Mattis_27.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_27.text: In the market for something special?
Mattis_27.context: NodeContext: 'Ahem' is said with gravitas, you're enjoying being a 'businessman'

Mattis_41.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_41.text: Thanks for bringing the crew back. If I open a shop in Baldur's Gate you're gonna get a discount! Not, like, a big one, but still.

Mattis_43.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_43.text: You had something to do with the light, right? I knew it - this is the end for Ketheric. Stock up while you can!
Mattis_43.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: gleeful at being right

Mattis_59.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_59.text: Seems like you need some extra supplies. What'll it be?
Mattis_59.context: NodeContext: Little worried but trying to be 'professional'

Mattis_61.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_61.text: Mol can be cranky, and mean, but she looks after us. So, stock up, all right? 'Cause you need all the help you can get to bring her home.

Mattis_66.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_66.text: Check it out - we've gone legitimate, and Mol put me in charge. Whaddya need?

Mattis_70.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_70.text: You got the coin this time? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Mattis_70.context: NodeContext: Cheeky - you don't expect the player to have the coin.

Mattis_76.speaker: Player
Mattis_76.text: You mentioned you had a key?

Mattis_2.speaker: Player
Mattis_2.text: I'd like to buy it from you.

Mattis_64.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_64.text: This is a, ahem, valuable piece, so it's gonna cost a lot. And that is non-negot... non... the price isn't changing! ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Mattis_64.context: NodeContext: trying to sound like a professional

Mattis_52.speaker: Player
Mattis_52.text: That's way too little. Here. Keep the change. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Mattis_82.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_82.text: Are you serious? Thanks so much! I've gotta tell Mol.

Mattis_34.speaker: Player
Mattis_34.text: You drive a hard bargain, but it's a deal. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Mattis_74.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_74.text: Yes! That's my first negotiation. Here. Pleasure doing business with you.
Mattis_74.context: NodeContext: delighted. Saying 'negotiation' like it's a super posh business word

Mattis_30.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_30.text: Oh no! I'm so sorry, I - I think I dropped it. This is so unprofessional, Mol is gonna kill me!
Mattis_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, patting your pocketsNodeContext: upset and frustrated with yourself

Mattis_12.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_12.text: As Mol would say - suit yourself.

Mattis_15.speaker: Player
Mattis_15.text: I'll be back with the money.

Mattis_47.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_47.text: Better hurry, I've got loads of interested parties.

Mattis_58.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_58.context: NodeContext: Rolling eyes, player has said they would be back with the money once already.

Mattis_20.speaker: Player
Mattis_20.text: Mol said I could have it.

Mattis_8.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_8.text: Really? But she said... all right. Here. I guess.

Mattis_25.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_25.text: Huh... No, no! Don't tell me I dropped it? I'm an idiot.
Mattis_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, patting your pocketsNodeContext: surprised then mad at yourself

Mattis_1.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_1.context: NodeContext: Like two kids fighting back and forth 'Nuh uh!' 'Yeah huh!'

Mattis_73.speaker: Player
Mattis_73.text: Give it or I'm telling Mol on you.

Mattis_49.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_49.text: Go ahead! It's mine. Got it?!

Mattis_86.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_86.text: Until she tells me that herself, I'm gonna hang onto it. Thanks.

Mattis_28.speaker: Player
Mattis_28.text: If it was worth any coin, do you think Mol would have given it to you?

Mattis_18.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_18.text: But she put me in charge of the shop! I thought... never mind. Here. You can have it, then.
Mattis_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

Mattis_29.speaker: Player
Mattis_29.text: Mol knows it'll be safer with me - and so do you.

Mattis_39.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_39.text: No way! This is my shop - that means I'm in charge of all the stuff in the shop. And that's that.

Mattis_75.speaker: Player
Mattis_75.text: With all the other fabulous things you've found in this inn, why hold on to a dusty old key?

Mattis_72.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_72.text: Hm. I guess it is kind of old. Here. Birds of a feather.

Mattis_90.speaker: Player
Mattis_90.text: Look - give it to me now, or I steal it later. The former is less embarrassing.

Mattis_4.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_4.text: She always says the stuff I like is junk. I'm gonna make a killing on this! You'll see.

Mattis_33.speaker: Player
Mattis_33.text: Take good care of that key.

Mattis_85.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_85.text: Don't worry - it isn't leaving my sight!

Mattis_48.speaker: Player
Mattis_48.text: You got any stock for an extra special customer like me?

Mattis_9.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_9.text: Hmm. I'm not supposed to mention it to anyone, but I do have something pretty special in stock. A key.

Mattis_54.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_54.text: What does it look like? What does it open? What treasures await behind its lock? That's for one lucky buyer to find out.

Mattis_84.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_84.text: Mol gave it to me, said I shouldn't let it go to just any old jack-a-day.

Mattis_50.speaker: Player
Mattis_50.text: Mol mentioned some 'silver junk' she'd found?

Mattis_36.speaker: Player
Mattis_36.text: Yours is the first happy face I've seen in a good while.

Mattis_53.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_53.text: I'm alive, ain't I? What's not to like.

Mattis_38.speaker: Player
Mattis_38.text: Let me see what you have.

Mattis_87.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_87.context: NodeContext: Very dodger oliver twist, hamming it up a bit

Mattis_88.speaker: Mattis
Mattis_88.text: I want to go back. Back to the way things were... What can I get you?
Mattis_88.context: NodeContext: Your friends are dead. Upset and grieving. Trying to get it together. Trying to shake it off and be professional in second setence.
